IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: SAN FRANCISCO DAY SCHOOL EDUCATES, NURTURES AND INSPIRES GIRLS AND BOYS OF DIVERSE BACKGROUNDS TO ACHIEVE THEIR HIGHEST ACADEMIC AND CREATIVE POTENTIAL, TO EMBRACE VALUES AND TO BECOME ACTIVE CONTRIBUTORS TO THEIR COMMUNITIES.
IRS990.MissionDescription: San Francisco Day School educates, nurtures and inspires girls and boys of diverse backgroungs to achieve their highest academic and creative potential, to embrace ethical values and to become active contributors to their communities. The School serves approximately 400 students, K-8 grades.
IRS990.Description: Academic excellence includes what is learned, how it is learned, and the context in which it is learned. The SFDS curriculum is innovative, characterized by gifted teaching and rigorous assessment. It piques the interests of and strives to attend to the needs of each child. SFDS prides itself as a community of learners in which intellectual curiosity and love of learning are valued.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE SCHOOL'S ENDOWMENT CONSISTS OF APPROXIMATELY 16 INDIVIDUAL FUNDS ESTABLISHED FOR A VARIETY OF PURPOSES. ITS ENDOWMENT INCLUDES DONOR-RESTRICTED ENDOWMENT FUNDS.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Income Taxes The School is a qualified organization exempt from federal income taxes under section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code and section 23701d of the California Revenue and Taxation Code. The School has adopted the accounting standard on accounting for uncertainty in income taxes, which prescribes a recognition threshold and measurement attribute for the financial statement recognition and measurement of a tax position taken, or expected to be taken, in a tax return and requires the affirmative evaluation that is more-likely-than-not, based on the technical merits of a tax position, that an enterprise is entitled to economic benefits resulting from tax positions taken in income tax returns. If a tax position does not meet the more-likely-than-not recognition threshold, the benefit of that position is not recognized in the financial statements. This standard also requires organizations to disclose additional quantitative and qualitative information in their financial statements about uncertain tax positions. The School's adoption of this standard did not have a material impact on the financial statements. The School's evaluation on June 30, 2010 revealed no tax positions that would have a material impact on the financial statements. The 2006 through 2009 tax years remain subject to examination by the Internal Revenue Service. In addition, the 2005 through 2009 tax years remain subject to examination by the California Franchise Tax Board. The School does not believe that any reasonably possible changes will occur within the next twelve months that will have a material impact on the financial statements.

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: THE RACIAL NON DISCRIMINATION POLICY WAS PUBLISHED IN THE SAN FRANCISCO CHRONICLE ON MAY 18, 2010. THE POLICY IS ALSO STATED IN ALL OF THE SCHOOL'S PUBLICATIONS.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: Grants and assistance are given to students according to those demonstrating financial need. These grants and assistance are monitored through an internal excel spreadsheet which is updated yearly.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: DAVID JACKSON, HEAD OF SCHOOL, RECEIVED $108,690 IN HOUSING ALLOWANCE.
David Jackson, Head of School receives a 457(b) and 457(f) plan. Contributions made to the 457(b) plan by the School were $16,500. Contribution made to the 457(f) plan by the School were $181,698.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE 990 IS PREPARED BY THE INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM THAT ALSO AUDITS THE ORGANIZATION. THE 990 IS THEN REVIEWED BY THE SCHOOL'S BUSINESS MANAGER AND IS ALSO REVIEWED AND SIGNED BY THE TREASURER OF THE GOVERNING BODY BEFORE IT IS FILED.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The School distributes the conflict of interest policy every year to all members of the board. Each board member will read the policy and sign off.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Compensation committee will review the salary of the Head of School looking at performance evaluations, comparing salary to other schools in the bay area. This is only done for the Head of School.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THESE DOCUMENTS ARE AVAILABLE FOR PUBLIC INSPECTION BY CONTACTING THE SCHOOL'S BUSINESS OFFICE AND REQUESTING THEM.
THE AUDIT OVERSIGHT PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM PRIOR YEAR.
